thread.title: Phillipsburg boys soccer out for revenge in H/W/S semifinal with Newton
thread.title_full: Phillipsburg boys soccer out for revenge in H/W/S semifinal with Newton

title: Phillipsburg boys soccer out for revenge in H/W/S semifinal with Newton
text:
Phillipsburg High School’s boys soccer team is on a mission to capture the program’s first county title since 1989. 
But, distributing some payback in the process wouldn’t hurt either. 
The Stateliners will get an opportunity for a little retribution after dispatching Vernon 2-1 in the Hunterdon/Warren/Sussex quarterfinals on Saturday. 
Third-seeded Phillipsburg (8-3-2) advances to play second-seeded Newton on Oct. 24. 
Newton, which defeated Hunterdon Central in penalty kicks on Saturday, eliminated the Stateliners from the 2013 county semifinals with a 3-2 scoreline. 
“We definitely want revenge on Newton,” Phillipsburg senior Joe Takacs said. “We lost to them two years ago, so it would be good get back at them, make the finals and win the tournament for the first time in a while.” 
Newton is 8-1-4 and leads the Northwest Jersey Athletic Conference Colonial Division (which also holds North Warren). 
“Anything can happen,” Stateliners coach Evan Weller said. “We certainly believe in ourselves. We believe we’re capable of doing some great things. We want to make sure that we’re mentally prepared.” 
Phillipsburg has already taken a small measure of revenge this fall by beating North Hunterdon in a regular-season contest, after the Lions beat the ’Liners three times in 2014, including in the H/W/S final. 
Now, if Phillipsburg is going to continue its journey toward ending its 26-year drought, it needs to check off another team from its payback list.
